title: One Killed , 7 Injured In Israeli Airstrikes In Lebanon
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Beirut, July 5 (IANS) A Hezbollah member was killed, and seven civilians were in Israeli and artillery shelling in southern Lebanon, Lebanese military sources said.
The sources noted that the Hezbollah member was killed, and three civilians were injured in an Israeli raid targeting a house in the village of Houla.
The sources indicated that the Israeli bombing destroyed 17 homes, damaged 35 others, and led to nine fires in the border area.
Meanwhile, Hezbollah announced that it attacked several Israeli military sites in retaliation for Israel's assassination of its senior military commander, Mohammad Naameh Nasser, a day earlier.
The level of tension between Hezbollah and the Israeli army has escalated recently, as the Israeli military announced "its approval of operational plans for an attack on Lebanon."
event_breakdown: Lebanese Hezbollah member killed, 7 civilians injured in Israeli and artillery shelling in Houla.

title: Russian colonel charged in absentia for ordering attacks on civilian infrastructure
message:
Russian colonel charged in absentia for ordering attacks on civilian infrastructureUkraine's Security Service (SBU) charged Russian Colonel Ivan Panchenko in absentia for ordering attacks on civilian infrastructure in eastern Ukraine, the SBU announced on July 4.
According to the SBU, Russian forces used a Su-35 fighter jet to fire a Kh-35 missile to strike the museum.
Evidence compiled by the SBU suggests Panchenko continues to order airstrikes onto various regions of Ukraine.
Panchenko is charged under multiple articles of Ukraine's Criminal Code pertaining to "violations of the laws and customs of war."

title: At least five killed in Israeli attack on Occupied West Bank city
message:
Palestinian authorities said five people were killed in Israeli strikes in the West Bank city of Jenin as people and emergency services attended the aftermath on Friday.
The Israeli military said it was conducting counterterrorism activity that included an airstrike in Jenin.
The military said Israeli soldiers had “encircled a building where terrorists have barricaded themselves in” and the soldiers were exchanging fire, while an airstrike had “struck several armed terrorists” in the area.
The clashes in Jenin, a known stronghold of resistance fighters, came a day after an Israeli anti-settlement monitoring group said the government plans to build nearly 5,300 new homes in settlements in the occupied West Bank.
Violence has spiraled in the West Bank since the start of Israel’s war on Gaza.
location: The West Bank city of Jenin.

title: Israeli strike kills another senior Hezbollah commander as diplomats scramble for calm in Lebanon - New Delhi Times - India Only International Newspaper
message:
An Israeli strike in southern Lebanon on Wednesday killed a senior Hezbollah commander as tensions between the two sides continue to boil, a Hezbollah official told The Associated Press.
A Hezbollah statement identified the killed commander as Mohammad Naameh Nasser, who went by the name “Abu Naameh,” his nom de guerre.
A Hezbollah official speaking anonymously in line with regulations, said he was head of the group’s Aziz Unit, one of three regional divisions in southern Lebanon.
The Israeli military acknowledged the attack, saying that Nasser alongside Abdullah are “two of the most significant Hezbollah” militants in southern Lebanon.
The attacks have since gradually escalated, with Hezbollah introducing new weapons in their attacks and Israel striking deeper into Lebanon.

title: Hezbollah rains 200 rockets on Israel as Gaza war rages
message:
Beirut: Lebanon's Hezbollah launched a barrage of more than 200 rockets and drones at Israeli army positions on Thursday as tensions soared amid the almost nine-month-old war raging in Gaza.
The group said its latest attack, which followed over 100 rockets fired the previous day, came in response to Israel's killing of a senior Hezbollah commander in south Lebanon.
Israel and Hezbollah, an ally of Hamas, have exchanged near daily cross-border fire since the Gaza war erupted on October 7, stoking fears of an escalation into all-out war.
Israel killed senior Hezbollah commander Mohammed Naameh Nasser with a strike in the Lebanese coastal city of Tyre on Wednesday.
His death came after an Israeli strike in June killed Taleb Abdallah, who headed another sector.
event_breakdown: Hezbollah fires wave of rockets at Israeli army positions in retaliation for killing of senior Hezbollah commander. (Beirut, Lebanon)

In response to the attacks, artillery forces and IAF jets attacked rocket and drone launching positions in Southern Lebanon, the military said.
“They all went to the protected space, but there was damage to a kindergarten.”The Iran-backed Hezbollah terrorist proxy took responsibility for the aerial attacks in a statement cited by Lebanon’s Al-Akhbar daily.
Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah has vowed to continue the attacks until a “complete and permanent ceasefire” is reached in Gaza.

title: Explosion In Khyber Pakhtunkhwa , Pakistan , Kills Three And Injures Eight
message:
(MENAFN- Khaama Press) Local officials in Pakistan have reported that at least three individuals were killed and eight others in a bomb blast in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province in northwest Pakistan.
According to local police in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, the target of the bombing was a vehicle carrying police personnel.
Babar Afridi, the local police officer, reiterated that the explosion occurred due to a planted bomb on a bridge in the Takhbai area of Mardan district.
Mr. Afridi further stated that initial investigations revealed the presence of a handmade bomb placed on the bridge.
Amidst these incidents, there has been an increase in attacks by Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) on Pakistani officials and foreign citizens, which Pakistani officials allege are supported and sheltered by the Taliban.

title: Hezbollah bombards Israeli military installations with 200 rockets .
message:
According to Lebanon’s National News Agency, Israeli jets breached the sound barrier over a number of the nation’s regions.
Hezbollah said that in retribution for Israel’s Wednesday assassination of Hezbollah leader Mohammed Nasser in the south, it had fired more than 200 missiles and a swarm of drones at ten Israeli military locations.
Approximately “200 projectiles and over 20 suspicious aerial targets were identified crossing from Lebanon into Israeli territory,” according to the Israeli military.
Speaking at a Beirut celebration honoring Nasser, senior Hezbollah official Hashem Safieddine hinted that his organization might expand its scope of attack.
The battle in Gaza ragesMeanwhile, the core of the tensions has been the Gaza war, which has continued unabated.
event_breakdown:
Israeli jets breached the sound barrier over a number of regions of Lebanon, including Beirut, Tyre, and Hermel, according to Lebanon’s National News Agency.
Hezbollah fired over 200 missiles and a swarm of drones towards ten Israeli military locations, including Israeli military positions in the north, in response to the assassination of its leader Mohammed Nasser.
The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) said they identified “more than 200 projectiles and over 20 suspicious aerial targets crossing from Lebanon into Israeli territory.”
No injuries or deaths have been confirmed so far.
IDF said the missiles were fired from the Gaza Strip and that 90 per cent of the rockets fired by Palestinian terrorist groups had been intercepted by Israel’s Iron Dome missile defense system.

title: Iran Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps gets powerful ships to confront adversaries well beyond the Persian Gulf
message:
Its new missile corvettes are the most heavily armed combatant ships in its fleet.
In the last three years, Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps Navy has commissioned hundreds of new vessels.
The Shahid Hassan Bagheri is one of three new Soleimani-class missile corvettes that are the most heavily armed warships in the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps Navy's fleet.
Though rare for frontline warships, some major navies do possess catamaran corvettes, including China, Russia, Taiwan, and Norway.
Three Soleimani-class corvettes, Shahid Soleimani, Shahid Hassan Bagheri, and Shahid Sayyad Shirazi, have been commissioned, while a fourth, Shahid Ra'is-Ali Delvari, is under construction.

title: Life and death in Gaza  safe zone  where food is scarce and Israel strikes without warning
message:
Nasser Hospital sits in the western part of the city, which is inside the Israeli-designated humanitarian "safe zone" where Palestinians have been told to go, according to maps provided by Israel's military.
The latest Israeli evacuation order affected about 250,000 people earlier this week across wide swathes of Gaza, the United Nations estimated.
Wednesday's airstrike hit an area that also includes a school-turned-shelter for displaced people, many of whom are living in makeshift tents.
The Israeli military did not immediately comment on the strike.
The Israeli military said Tuesday it estimates at least 1.8 million Palestinians are now in the humanitarian zone it declared, covering a stretch of about 14 kilometers (8.6 miles) along the Mediterranean.

title: Tragedy Strikes Wedding as Suicide Bomber Targets Celebrants in Nigeria
message:
In a heartbreaking incident at a wedding in Maiduguri, Nigeria, Adamu Buba witnessed a devastating suicide bombing.
A woman, disguised as a guest, detonated explosives, resulting in her death and the deaths of 10 others.
The attack was an agonizing moment during what was supposed to be a joyous event, knocking Buba to the ground and leaving him disoriented amidst the chaos of shattered bodies and destruction.
This tragic bombing was just the first of four attacks in a week, with Boko Haram suspected to be behind them, targeting various civilian and security installations.
Such acts serve as grim reminders of the ongoing insurgency in the region.

title: AFP to  harden  facilities vs . missile threats , other attacks

"A missile attack is a possibility, yun nga po, naireport na may 25 targets dito (it was earlier reported that there are 25 targets here).
That is why we are also preparing for those, ang isa pong pwede nating gawin (one of those steps) is to harden our facilities.

Images of Ahmed Al-Najjar, 21, have emerged from Gaza.

title: Russian air defences downed over 42 , 000 targets since start of Ukraine conflict | Central India Premier English Daily
message:
Moscow, July 5 (UNI) The Russian air defence forces and air defence means have destroyed more than 42,000 air targets, including over 550 aircraft and 27,000 drones, since the beginning of Russia’s special military operation in Ukraine, Lt. Gen. Andrei Semenov, commander of the air and missile defence forces and deputy commander-in-chief of the Russian Aerospace Forces, told journalists.
“In total, more than 42,000 air targets have been destroyed by the air defence forces during the special military operation.
This includes more than 550 planes, over 180 helicopters, and more than 27,000 UAVs [unmanned aerial vehicles],” Semenov said.
The commander added that about a third of Ukraine’s manned aircraft have been destroyed by short-range air defence systems from forward echelons.
In total, these systems have destroyed a third of the manned aviation of the Ukrainian armed forces,” the general said.
event_breakdown:
The Russian air defence forces and Russian air defence means have destroyed more than 42,000 air targets, including over 550 planes, over 180 helicopters, and more than 27,000 unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), since President Vladimir Putin gave orders to start the invasion of Ukraine on February 24.
The drone targets have been reported destroyed in Ukraine too.

title: 7 Palestinians killed in West Bank by an Israeli raid and airstrike in the Jenin area
message:
7 Palestinians killed in West Bank by an Israeli raid and airstrike in the Jenin areaWorld World 7 Palestinians killed in West Bank by an Israeli raid and airstrike in the Jenin area7 Palestinians killed in West Bank by an Israeli raid and airstrike in the Jenin areaFollow on Published On: Fri, 05 Jul 2024 23:08:50 PKTJERUSALEM (AP) — Palestinian authorities say seven people were killed Friday during an Israeli military operation in the area of the West Bank city of Jenin, where the Israeli military said it had been carrying out “counterterrorism activity” that included an airstrike.
The clashes in Jenin, a known militant stronghold where the army frequently operates, came a day after an Israeli anti-settlement monitoring group said the government plans to build nearly 5,300 new homes in settlements in the occupied West Bank.
The construction plans revealed by the Peace Now group are part of the hard-line government’s efforts to beef up settlements as part of a strategy of cementing Israel’s control over the West Bank to prevent a future Palestinian state.
The Palestinians seek the West Bank, east Jerusalem and Gaza — areas captured by Israel in the 1967 Mideast war — for an independent state.
In Gaza, the war has so far killed more than 38,000 Palestinians, Gaza’s Health Ministry says.
event_breakdown: Security forces in the Gaza city of Khan Younis say they engaged with protesters on Friday, killing at least four of them and injuring 30. The demonstrators attempted to remove sections of the security boundary between the Gaza Strip and Egypt.Israeli forces in Khan Younis, Gaza razed 100 acres of agricultural farm land, displacing 500 Palestinian refugee families.

2 people killed during stabbing spree in Huntington Beach 2 people killed during stabbing spree in Huntington Beach 02:01Two people were killed and three others were wounded during a violent stabbing in Huntington Beach late Thursday evening, just hours after the city's popular Fourth of July celebration.
It happened at around 11:15 p.m., when police were sent to the area near 16th Street and Pelican Avenue after learning of an assault with a deadly weapon, according to the Huntington Beach Police Department.
Circumstances leading up to the attack remain unclear, and HBPD Major Crimes Unit personnel could be seen scouring the area early Friday morning.
They later identified him as Logan Kelly, a 26-year-old Huntington Beach resident.
"I've never experienced that before," said Jack Behimer, who has lived in the area for more than 30 years.

The circumstances leading up to the attack remain under investigation, and HBPD Major Crimes Unit personnel could be seen scouring the area early Friday morning.

Details: It is reported that the Russians had launched the drones from the vicinities of the Russian cities of Kursk and Primorsko-Akhtarsk.
The attack was repelled by fighter aircraft, anti-aircraft missile units of the Air Force, mobile fire groups of Ukrainian defence forces and electronic warfare units.

Reported by: Ukraine’s Air Force

Target news: The Ukrainian Air Force reported repelling a Russian drone attack on 4 July. The Air Force stated that the attack, which included drones launched from the Russian cities of Kursk and Primorsko-Akhtarsk, took place in six oblasts of Ukraine. The drones were shot down by Ukrainian fighter aircraft, anti-aircraft missile units, mobile fire groups, and electronic warfare units. The remains of downed Russian drones damaged six private houses and a car in Bucha district in Kyiv Oblast, although there were no casualties.

title: Turkish police catch 45 Daesh - linked suspects in 16 cities
message:
Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya on Friday said Turkish authorities have captured a total of 45 suspects linked to the Daesh terrorist group in nationwide raids.
Türkiye has been rounding up Daesh-linked suspects in ramped-up operations since the terrorist group attacked an Italian church in Istanbul in late January, killing one man during Sunday Mass.
The National Intelligence Organization (MIT) thwarted the terrorist group's efforts for recruitment, obtaining funds and logistics support after its latest operation in the aftermath of the church shooting.
Daesh members have not previously targeted places of worship on Turkish soil.
In December last year, Turkish intelligence captured a top Daesh terrorist in charge of the terrorist group’s finances in the Damascus region in an operation in Türkiye’s southern Mersin province.
location: The operation took place in Istanbul

title: Pakistan : 3 killed , 8 injured in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa blast
message:
Islamabad, July 5 : At least three people were killed and eight others injured when a blast went off in Pakistan's northwest Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province on Friday, the police said.
The blast took place on a bridge in the Takht-i-Bahi area of Mardan district of the province, killing three people while injuring eight others, including policemen, District Police Officer Mardan Zahoor Babar Afridi told the media.
Rescue teams, police, and security forces immediately reached the site following the blast and shifted the injured to a nearby hospital.
The area has been cordoned off while a search operation is underway to arrest the culprits.
Earlier on Thursday, five people, including a former member of the Senate, were killed in an explosion in Bajaur district of the province.
event_breakdown: Fatal blast in northwest Pakistan kills 3, injures 8

title: Bangkok Post - S Korean man sentenced to 15 years for stabbing party leader
message:
S Korean man sentenced to 15 years for stabbing party leaderLee Jae-myung, leader of the main opposition Democratic Party, attends an event to disband the election camp for the 22nd parliamentary election in Seoul, South Korea, on April 11, 2024.
(Photo: Reuters)SEOUL - A South Korean court sentenced a man to 15 years in prison for stabbing the leader of the main opposition party, which was one of the most high-profile cases of political violence in the country in recent years.
Prosecutors had sought a 20-year prison term for Kim on charges of attempted murder and violation of the election law.
Kim stabbed Democratic Party leader Lee Jae-myung in the neck in January, just months before South Korea was to hold general elections.
Lee underwent surgery, survived the attack and went on to lead the party to a landslide victory in the April parliamentary vote.

title: Slovakia prime minister makes 1st public appearance since assassination attempt – Winnipeg Free Press
message:
BRATISLAVA, Slovakia (AP) — Slovakia’s populist Prime Minister Robert Fico made his first public appearance on Friday since he was seriously wounded in an assassination attempt, attacking his liberal political opponents and praising his Hungarian counterpart.
FILE - Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico arrives for a cabinet's away-from-home session in the town of Handlova, Slovakia, on May, 15, 2024.
Fico made his first public appearance on Friday July 5, 2024 since he was seriously wounded in an assassination attempt, attacking his liberal political opponents and praising his Hungarian counterpart.
In his adress, Fico, who was standing on the stage, attacked what he called liberal and progressivist ideologies and praised Hungary’s Prime Minister Viktor Orbán for his recent trips to Kyiv and Moscow.
His critics worry that Slovakia could abandon its pro-Western course and follow the direction of Hungary under Prime Minister Viktor OrbánThousands have repeatedly rallied in the capital and across Slovakia to protest Fico’s policies.
event_breakdown: Slovakian Prime Minister Robert Fico made his first public appearance Friday after being seriously injured in an assassination attempt, attacking liberal politicians and praising his Hungarian counterpart

“Basically, his front passenger window just explodes and he feels a huge concussion inside the car,” Henderson said.

message:
UPDATE: Police announce suspects in stabbing, murder in CranstonEdwin Torres and Destiny Torres are being accused of running one man over, killing him, while stabbing a 15-year-old early Friday, July 5.
(WLNE)CRANSTON, R.I. (WLNE) — Police have announced the names of the suspects arrested in an early morning stabbing and murder that happened on Oak Street this morning in Cranston.
23-year-old Destiny Torres of North Providence was arrested and charged with one count of felony assault with a dangerous weapon, a knife, for the stabbing of a 15-year-old male.
24-year-old Edwin Torres of Cranston was arrested and charged with one count of murder in the death of 21-year-old Isaac Vasquez of Cranston.
The Cranston Police Detective Unit, BCI Unit, Traffic Unit along with the Rhode Island Attorney General’s Office are currently working on this investigation and it is ongoing.

title: 8 - year - old stabbed to death in Queens , suspect fatally shot by police
message:
NEW YORK -- A police officer shot and killed a man who allegedly stabbed an 8-year-old boy to death in Queens on Thursday, the New York City Police Department said.
Police said the 20-year-old suspect and the 8-year-old male victim may be brothers or step-brothers.
Police say when officers entered the apartment, they found the suspect holding his 43-year-old father at knifepoint.
The suspect allegedly refused repeated commands to drop the knife, and an officer then fired one round, striking the suspect, police said.
Officers immediately rendered aid, and the suspect was taken to an area hospital, where he died.

title: Oslo Pride shooter handed maximum sentence - Newspaper
message:
OSLO: The gunman who killed two people at Oslo’s 2022 Pride festival was handed decades behind bars on Thursday over the attack that the court said aimed to “instill fear in LGBTQ people”.
Zaniar Matapour, who pledged allegiance to the the militant Islamic State group, was found guilty of opening fire on June 25, 2022 outside two bars in central Oslo, including a famous gay club, just hours before the Pride Parade.
Norway handed the 45-year-old Norwegian of Iranian origin the maximum penalty of 30 years behind bars — with possible extensions — for committing an “aggravated act of terror.” “The attack undoubtedly targeted gay people,” the Oslo court said in its verdict.
Matapour, who was restrained by passersby after the shooting, has never revealed his motives.
Psychiatric experts have been divided over his mental health, and thereby his legal responsibility, as the accused has previously been diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia.
event_breakdown: Event: On Thursday, the Oslo court sentenced gunman Zaniar Matapour to 30 years behind bars for killing two people at the 2022 Pride festival in Oslo, Norway. The court said the attack aimed to “instill fear in LGBTQ people”. The gunman committed an “aggravated act of terror”.

title: Institute develops powerful explosive
message:
Institute develops powerful explosiveBOLSTERING DEFENSE: The explosive is 40 percent more powerful than those in use and could be deployed for Hsiung Feng II and III missiles, a government source saidBy Lo Tien-pin and Jake Chung / Staff reporter, with staff writerThe Chungshan Institute of Science and Technology has developed a polycyclic nitroamine explosive, commonly known as CL-20, which is the most powerful non-nuclear explosive known, a government source said yesterday on condition of anonymity.
The institute has significantly improved explosive and rocket propellant research and development in recent years, the source said.
The explosive is 40 percent more powerful than those currently used and could be deployed for Hsiung Feng II (“Brave Wind” II, HF-II) and HF-III missiles, the source said.
Despite difficulties in mass production, CL-20 has seen some minor uses within the US and China, and has also been used in the Russia-Ukraine war, the source said.
In tandem with domestic companies, the institute has researched and built a 1,136-liter mixer from the ground up, further enhancing the autonomy of Taiwan’s national defense sector.

title: President awards 6 CRPF personnel , including 4 posthumously , for gallantry
message:
Six Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel, including four posthumously, were decorated with military gallantry medals by President Droupadi Murmu during a defence investiture ceremony held here on Friday.
They were recognised for displaying gallant action during an anti-Naxal operation in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on April 3, 2021.
Twenty-two security personnel, including eight from the CRPF, were killed in action during this gun battle, followed by a Naxal ambush that went on for six hours.
The President awarded Kirti Chakras to the next of kin of these personnel who displayed extraordinary bravery and inflicted heavy casualties on the Maoists, a force spokesperson said quoting their gallantry citations.
Ms. Murmu also awarded Shaurya Chakras to two other personnel of the country's largest paramilitary force for showing gallantry during an anti-Naxal operation and a counter-terrorist action in Jammu and Kashmir.
event_breakdown: CRPF personnel were awarded Shaurya Chakras and Kirti Chakras posthumously for their bravery during an anti-Naxal operation in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on April 3, 2021.

title: Good Party calls for urgent crime intervention on the Cape Flats
message:
CAPE TOWN - The Good Party is calling on the City of Cape Town to urgently address escalating crime in the Cape Flats.
Ongoing shootings in various areas and a raging gang war in Ottery, Lotus River and Grassy Park have left dozens dead, with no end to the violence in sight.
Good Party Spokesperson Janke Tolmay said the city must admit that there is no evidence that the Law Enforcement Advancement Programme (LEAP) initiative is successful in reducing violent crime.
READ: Former gangster laments brutality of gang violence gripping Cape FlatsTolmay said to combat crime effectively, it is essential to strengthen partnerships with neighborhood watches and community policing forums.
Meanwhile, the city has urged residents to come forward with information to assist in hunting down suspects related to the recent shootings in Ottery.

title: Decisive World War 2 battle in Ilocos Sur remembered
message:
Honoring the Heroes: Battle in Ilocos Sur RememberedThe 79th anniversary of the Battle of Bessang Pass, the most decisive battle of the Second World War in the Philippines, which helped turn the tide of the war, was recently observed in the highlands of Ilocos Sur.
Fought from Jan. 9 to June 14, 1945, the battle took place in the highland towns of Ilocos Sur.
Highlighting the solemn event is the wreath-laying, military honors and 21-gun salute to the war dead.
Another highlight is the awarding of the PVAO World War II Victory Medals to surviving nonagenarian guerillas Vicente Cabello and Dominador Cabatic who fought in the said battle.
The historical reenactors were brought in by the Philippine Veterans Bank as part of its advocacy to keep the uncommon valor of war veterans alive.

title: What is the U . S . Indo - Pacific Command ( INDOPACOM )?
message:
U.S. Indo-Pacific Command, or INDOPACOM, is one of the U.S. Department of Defense’s eleven unified combatant commands that together span the globe.
Forces Japan, U.S. Special Operations Command Pacific, U.S. Pacific Fleet, U.S. Marine Forces Pacific, U.S. Pacific Air Forces, and U.S. Army Pacific.
It is the result of a merger between three commands–Far East Command, Pacific Command and Alaskan Command–which were established after World War II in 1947.
By 1957, Pacific Command saw a major expansion and strategic reorientation of its AOR, absorbing the Far East Command and most of the Alaskan Command.
In 2018, Pacific Command was rebranded to Indo-Pacific Command, or INDOPACOM, as it is known today.

title: Fico praises Orban in first public appearance since assassination attempt

Fico praises Orban in first public appearance since assassination attemptSlovak Prime Minister Robert Fico on July 5 made his first public appearance since being seriously injured in an assassination attempt in May.
Fico, 59, was shot in an assassination attempt as he walked out of a government meeting in the town of Handlova on May 15.
The attack left the prime minister in serious condition, and he has since undergone two surgeries.
During his speech, Fico criticized what he referred to as liberal and progressive political ideologies and expressed praise for Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
Cintula reportedly told authorities that shot Fico because he disagreed with "certain policies" of the current government.

title: Police investigating after stabbing victim walks into Toronto hospital
message:
Toronto police are investigating after a man who had been stabbed walked into a hospital Friday evening.
Police were called to the area of Spadina Avenue and Bathurst Street at 10:18 p.m. for a stabbing.
Officers arrived to learn that a man had shown up at a hospital with a stab wound.
They later discovered that the stabbing occurred near Spadina Avenue and Fort York Boulevard.
Police have released a limited description of the suspect, a 35-year-old man who is five feet six inches tall and was wearing all black clothing.

title: HBPD : 2 People Killed , 3 Hurt in Huntington Beach Attack ; Man in Custody
message:
A stabbing attack in Huntington Beach left two people dead, and three other people injured, and a man was in custody Friday on suspicion of murder and attempted murder.
The attack was reported about 11:15 p.m. Thursday near 16th Street and Pecan Avenue, according to the Huntington Beach Police Department.
Logan Kelley, 26, of Huntington Beach, was arrested and booked on suspicion of murder and attempted murder, Jennifer Carey of the city of Huntington Beach told City News Service on Friday.
“HBPD has no reason to believe there is any further public safety threat related to this incident,” police said.
“The investigation into this incident is ongoing and no additional details will be released at this time.”

title: Last of Rochester Hills splash pad shooting victims out of the hospital
message:
Last of Rochester Hills splash pad shooting victims out of the hospitalGRAND RAPIDS, Mich. (WOOD) — Three weeks after a gunman opened fired at a splash pad in southeastern Michigan, the last of the nine people injured was released from the hospital Friday, authorities say.
The Oakland County Sheriff’s Office said in a release that the 39-year-old Rochester Hills woman was shot multiple times trying to protect her children.
“While we are incredibly pleased all shooting victims have been released from the hospital, we know there is a long road ahead on both the physical and psychological healing,” Sheriff Michael Bouchard said in a statement.
“Our support will remain with the victims, and we will continue to look for any information that gives insight into the motive of the shooter.”The shooting happened June 15 at a splash pad in the Detroit suburb of Rochester Hills.
Authorities have indicated the attack was random — the shooter didn’t have any link to those shot or the splash pad.

title: Muharram 2024 key dates for start of Islamic New Year and the Day of Ashura
message:
The Islamic calendar is now heading towards the end of the year 1445 and the start of 1446, with Muharram the first month.
The 10th day of Muharram is known as the Day of Ashura, which is observed by both Sunni and Shia Muslims.
Key dates in Muharram:1st Muharram: Islamic new year.
The Islamic calendar is based on the moon, and 12 lunar cycles amount to 354 days.
The difference between the two calendars is 10 or 11 days, meaning Islamic dates move forward by 10 or 11 days a year.

title: Canada names first woman to lead its military
message:
Lieutenant-General Jennie Carignan, tasked with addressing ingrained sexism and misconduct in the armed forces, will assume the role of Chief of the Defense Staff on July 18.
Carignan, originally a military engineer, has commanded troops in Afghanistan, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Iraq, and Syria during her 35-year military career.
The armed forces are currently struggling to meet recruitment goals and have been slow to replace outdated equipment.
Additionally, the last two governors-general, the official representatives of the British monarchy, have been women appointed by Trudeau.
She joined the military in 1986, three years before Canada allowed women in combat roles.

title: Slovakia PM says would have joined Orban on Moscow visit AFP - World
message:
Slovakian Prime Minister Robert Fico, who survived an assassination attempt, said he would have joined his Hungarian counterpart, Viktor Orban, on his trip to Russia if his health allowed, AFP reported.
Orban traveled to Moscow for talks with Russian leader Vladimir Putin on July 5.
The visit came three days after the Hungarian premier made a trip to Kiev.
An armed attack on Fico took place in the western Slovakian town of Handlova in mid-May.
The attacker, Juraj Cintula, 71, has been charged with a politically-motivated assassination attempt.

title: Slovakia PM makes first public appearance since assassination attempt
message:
Slovakia’s populist Prime Minister Robert Fico made his first public appearance on Friday since he was seriously wounded in an assassination attempt.
In his address Mr Fico, who was standing on the stage, attacked what he called liberal and progressivist ideologies and praised Hungary’s Prime Minister Viktor Orban for his recent trips to Kyiv and Moscow.
Mr Fico ended his country’s military aid for Ukraine after his coalition government was sworn in on October 25.
His critics worry that Slovakia could abandon its pro-Western course and follow the direction of Hungary under Mr Orban.
Thousands have repeatedly rallied in the capital and across Slovakia to protest Mr Fico’s policies.
event_breakdown:
Security forces in Slovakia have raided properties in several locations as they target Slovak National Party deputy leader and MP Stanislav Mizík on corruption charges.
Mizík and another three individuals are accused of illegally procuring the deal with UK company Lex Auto Trade, which has cost the country millions of euros.
Since forming a government back in October, Fico's administration has ended military aid for Ukraine.

title: 8 arrested after gruesome murder of Indian politician
message:
Eight people were arrested in India on Saturday for the murder of a politician who championed the rights of lower-caste Indians, police said.
Six men travelling on motorbikes attacked Armstrong while he was "chatting with friends and supporters" near his home in the Tamil Nadu state capital, the Indian Express newspaper reported.
Several of Armstrong's supporters took to the streets later in the evening to protest his assassination and demand justice.
Mayawati, the national head of Armstrong's BSP, who uses one name, said the attack was "highly deplorable and condemnable".
"Armstrong's assassination is shocking and deeply saddening," he said.

title: Mardan blast claims three lives
message:
At least three people were killed and seven others injured on Friday in a bomb blast near Jalala bridge in the Takht Bhai tehsil of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa’s Mardan district.
District Police Officer Zahoor Babar Afridi said a remote-controlled device exploded immediately after a police vehicle passed over the bridge.
Confirming the casualties, the official explained that the people who died in the blast were travelling in a rickshaw, which was damaged along with the police vehicle.
The injured civilians were admitted to Tehsil Headquarters Hospital Takhtbhai while the policemen hurt in the blast were rushed to Mardan Medical Complex.

title: UN warns of escalation of tension on Lebanon - Israel border

UN warns of escalation of tension on Lebanon-Israel borderXinhua) 10:32, July 06, 2024UNITED NATIONS, July 5 (Xinhua) -- The United Nations expressed grave concerns on Friday about intensified clashes along the Lebanon-Israel frontier, known as the Blue Line.
The world body highlighted the mounting tensions following an increase in exchanges of fire between Lebanese and Israeli forces.
This recent surge in hostilities, which occurred on Thursday, "heightens the risk of a full-scale war," according to a note from the office of the spokesperson for the UN secretary-general.

title: Ukrainian troops pay last respects to Briton killed in clash with Russian forces
message:
Peter Fouche, 49, died “in the battlefield” on June 27 as his unit clashed with Russian troops, according to his colleague at Project Konstantin, the volunteer group that since 2022 has ferried drones, vehicles, uniforms and food to Ukrainian soldiers in the east.
Comrades of Peter Fouche at the funeral in Kyiv (Alex Babenko/AP)According to its website, it has also helped evacuate 219 Ukrainian soldiers from combat zones.
At the funeral ceremony, Ukrainian soldiers carried Mr Fouche’s coffin through Kyiv’s landmark Independence Square, the site of mass protests in 2014 that forced out a pro-Russian president.
Mr Fouche’s comrades held back tears as they lined up to say goodbye.
At least five other Britons have been killed while volunteering in Ukraine since Russia’s full-scale invasion in February 2022.

title: Indonesia TNI needs fourth branch : cyber military force
message:
Indonesia's TNI needs fourth branch: cyber military forceRelated news: Minister ensures strengthened national data center security systemRelated news: Jokowi urges national data backup after cyberattackSemarang (ANTARA) - The Indonesian National Armed Forces (TNI) comprises three branches: the Indonesian Army (TNI AD), Indonesian Navy (TNI AL), and Indonesian Air Force (TNI AU).
Ignoring the possibility of a cyberattack preceding a conventional assault would be imprudent.
A nation caught unprepared could be left highly vulnerable.Indonesia is not powerless in terms of cybersecurity.
The National Intelligence Agency (BIN), National Police (Polri), National Cyber and Crypto Agency (BSSN), and the Ministry of Communication and Informatics all play a role.However, none of these institutions has the sole responsibility of fortifying Indonesia's defenses and repelling cyberattacks.
He said that the TNI needs personnel who can analyze cyber threats and fortify its internal systems.Before establishing a fourth force, the TNI needs to ensure its existing branches have personnel capable of monitoring and conducting cyber intelligence operations.Both infrastructure and skilled personnel are crucial to defending Indonesia from cutting-edge threats.

title: Nothing Good Would Come of an Israeli War in Lebanon
message:
Last week, former Israeli Minister and retired General Benny Gantz said that Israel could destroy Hezbollah’s military in a matter of days.
Israel’s relentless, methodical shelling of a five-kilometer-deep area along the border inside Lebanon has created a de facto, uninhabitable dead zone.
Hezbollah wants Israel to stop shelling Lebanon, withdraw from disputed border points, and stop overflights of Lebanon.
As I have written before in this space, neither Hezbollah’s patron, Iran, nor Israel particularly wants a full-scale war in Lebanon.
In 2006, Hezbollah kidnapped and killed several Israeli soldiers at the border, and Israel responded with a devastating military campaign against Hezbollah and Lebanon.

title: The Immigration War No One Talks About
message:
The Dutch Boers (lit: farmers, also called Afrikaners) in South Africa fled inland, away from the Cape Colony, after the British took it over in 1814.
In 1881, the Boers won the First Boer War, which secured their independence, though the British claimed they were still a vassal state.
When the Boer War started, almost no one on the planet rooted for the British.
The Boer War had been fought for the control of gold by the elite, not for the common man.
The Boer War is a cornerstone to history, and no one teaches it rightly.

title: Five journalists killed as Israel steps up bombardment across Gaza
message:
Their children were also killed during the strike, according to Al Jazeera’s team on the ground.
Before the latest deadly attacks, Israel’s war on Gaza was already considered the deadliest conflict for journalists and media workers in the world.
The New York-based Committee to Protect Journalists, which has a separate database on Palestinian journalists killed in Gaza, put the number of media workers killed as of July 5 at 108 since the war began, also making it the deadliest period since the group began gathering data in 1992.
Al Jazeera journalist, Hamza Dahdouh, the eldest son of Al Jazeera’s Gaza bureau chief, Wael Dahdouh, was among those killed by an Israeli missile strike in Khan Younis, southern Gaza, in January.
An earlier Israeli attack had wounded Wael and killed his cameraperson Samer Abudaqa during a reporting assignment in southern Gaza in December.

title: Israeli strikes kill 16 at school housing displaced Gazans , health officials say
message:
(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelCAIRO/GAZA: At least 16 people were killed in an Israeli strike on a school sheltering displaced Palestinian families in Al-Nuseirat in central Gaza on Saturday, the territory's health ministry and the official Palestinian news agency said.The Israeli military said it was looking into the report.The health ministry said the attack on the school killed at least 16 people and wounded more than 50.
Mahmoud Basal , spokesman of the Gaza Civil Emergency Service, said the number of dead could rise because many of the wounded were in critical condition.The attack on the school meant no place in the enclave was safe for families who leave their houses to seek shelters, he said in a statement.Al-Nuseirat, one of Gaza Strip's eight historic refugee camps, was the site of stepped-up Israeli bombardment on Saturday.
An air strike earlier on a house in the camp killed at least 10 people and wounded many others, according to medics.In its daily update of people killed in the nearly nine-month-old war, the Gaza health ministry said Israeli military strikes across the enclave killed at least 29 Palestinians in the past 24 hours and wounded 100 others.Among those killed in separate air strikes were five local journalists, raising the toll of journalists killed since Oct. 7 to 158, according to the Hamas-led Gaza government media office.Gaza health authorities say more than 38,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's offensive.
Israel launched its operation, aimed at eliminating the militant Islamist group Hamas, in response to a Hamas-led assault on Israel on Oct. 7 in which 1,200 people were killed and over 250 taken hostage, according to Israeli tallies.Israeli forces, which have deepened their incursions into Rafah, in the south of the enclave near the border with Egypt, killed four Palestinian policemen and wounded eight others, in an air strike on their vehicle on Saturday, health officials said.A statement issued by the Hamas-run interior ministry said the four included Fares Abdel-Al, the head of the police force in western Rafah neighbourhood of Tel Al-Sultan.The Israeli military said forces continued "intelligence-base operations" in Rafah, destroyed several underground structures, seized weapons and equipment, and killed several Palestinian gunmen.Israel has said its operations in Rafah aim to eradicate the last Hamas armed wing battalions.The Israeli military said it eliminated a Hamas rocket cell in Deir Al-Balah in central Gaza that operated from inside a humanitarian-designated area.
It said it carried out a precise strike after taking measures to ensure civilians were unharmed.Hamas denies Israeli accusations that it uses civilian properties and facilities for military purposes.The armed wings of Hamas and the Islamic Jihad said fighters attacked Israeli forces in several areas of Gaza with anti-tank rockets and mortar bombs.

title: Slovakian PM makes first public appearance since assassination attempt
message:
Slovakia’s populist Prime Minister Robert Fico made his first public appearance on Friday since he was seriously wounded in an assassination attempt, attacking his liberal political opponents and praising his Hungarian counterpart, AP reported.
Fico gave a speech on a stage at an evening gathering to mark the 1,161 anniversary of Saints Cyril and Methodius’s arrival, a national holiday in his country.
People gave him a standing ovation when he arrived at the Devin Castle in the capital.
Fico ended his country’s military aid for Ukraine after his coalition government was sworn in on Oct. 25.
He also opposes EU sanctions on Russia, and wants to block Ukraine from joining NATO.

title: Arrests after two men reportedly stabbed in city
message:
Police were called to reports of a fight on Thompson Road [Google]Two men have been arrested after reports of a stabbing during a fight in Sheffield.
Officers were called to reports of fighting outside a property on Thompson Road in the Broomhall area of the city shortly after 21:00 BST on Friday.
Two men were taken to hospital with injuries "consistent with a stabbing" but their injuries are not believed to be life-threatening, police said.
The men, aged 54 and 18, have been arrested on suspicion of grievous bodily harm.
Police are appealing for anyone who was in the area at the time with information, CCTV or dashcam footage to get in touch.
event_breakdown: Police have arrested two individuals in Sheffield, England, following a stabbing incident that happened on June 10, 2022. title: Newly unveiled document reveals details of WWII Japanese germ warfare unit
message:
A document containing detailed information about military personnel from Unit 731, a Japanese germ warfare unit during World War II, was unveiled for the first time in Harbin, the capital of northeast China's Heilongjiang Province, July 6, 2024.
/CMGA document containing detailed information about military personnel from Unit 731, a Japanese germ warfare unit during World War II, was unveiled for the first time on Saturday in Harbin, the capital of northeast China's Heilongjiang Province.
On December 2, 1940, the Japanese Kwantung Army established four detachments for Unit 731 in Northeast China.
The newly unveiled document detailed this detachment, revealing that its organizational structure and personnel configuration closely mirrored those of Unit 731.
"This further proves that the detachment collaborated with Unit 731 in conducting plague experiments and producing plague germ weapons."

The Ukrainian governor of the Luhansk region, which encompasses Sievierodonetsk, said Russian forces had launched an “unrelenting” attack and were blowing up bridges to isolate the city and cut off Ukrainian defenders.
9 civilians have been killed and 25 wounded in the region over the past 24 hours, the governor, Serhiy Gaidai, wrote on Telegram.

title: Ukrainian troops pay last respects to Briton killed in clash with Russian forces
message:
Peter Fouche, 49, died “in the battlefield” on June 27 as his unit clashed with Russian troops, according to his colleague at Project Konstantin, the volunteer group that since 2022 has ferried drones, vehicles, uniforms and food to Ukrainian soldiers in the east.
Comrades of Peter Fouche at the funeral in Kyiv (Alex Babenko/AP)According to its website, it has also helped evacuate 219 Ukrainian soldiers from combat zones.
At the funeral ceremony, Ukrainian soldiers carried Mr Fouche’s coffin through Kyiv’s landmark Independence Square, the site of mass protests in 2014 that forced out a pro-Russian president.
Mr Fouche’s comrades held back tears as they lined up to say goodbye.
At least five other Britons have been killed while volunteering in Ukraine since Russia’s full-scale invasion in February 2022.

Russian strikes overnight left over 100,000 households without power in northern Ukraine and cut off the water supply to a regional capital, Ukrainian authorities reported Saturday, while civilian casualties rose sharply in the country's embattled east.

In the Donetsk region in the east, Russian shelling on Friday and overnight killed 11 civilians and wounded 43, local Gov. Pavlo Kyrylenko said. Donetsk and Luhansk are the breakaway region of the so-called Donetsk People's Republic.

Kyrylenko said another two civilians were killed in an attack on Friday in the city of Kramatorsk, which regional officials earlier said could have been caused by cluster munitions. Residents hunkered in their houses as buildings around them shook from apparent explosions.

The Ukrainian General Staff on Saturday morning said that Ukrainian and Russian forces clashed 45 times near Pokrovsk over the previous day. It said Russian forces fired on 31 settlements in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions, destroying or damaging 42 civilian sites, including 26 homes and a school.

title: Footage reveals : The weapons IDF forces found in the heart of Shejaiya
message:
In the last week, the 7th Brigade Combat Team has been operating under the command of the 98th Division.
The soldiers are engaging in combat against terrorists, both above and below ground, and are eliminating them using tank fire and directing aerial fire.
During the operations in the Shejaiya area, the soldiers located underground tunnel shafts and confiscated weapons and long-range rockets indicating a renewed attempt by the enemy to establish a base in the area.
In addition, the soldiers destroyed booby-trapped explosives that the enemy had buried in the area.
This week, during the fighting in the area, Captain Roy Miller z”l, of the Rotem Battalion, and Captain Elay Elisha Lugasi z”l, of the 75th Battalion, fell in combat.
event_breakdown:
Army Kills Terrorists
The 98th Division of the United States Army killed 40 terrorists and destroyed underground tunnels and weapons caches during combat operations in the Shejaiya area.

title: IDF destroys building where Sergeant Ori Itzchak Hadad fell
message:
The Nahal Brigade Combat Team is operating in the Rafah area under the command of the 162nd Division.
The soldiers are carrying out scans in areas that were used by terrorists to prepare for combat, as well as locating operational tunnel shafts in residential buildings.
In one of the scans, soldiers of the Nahal Reconnaissance Unit located and dismantled an underground storage facility where weapons, explosives, cartridges and rockets were found.
During the activity in the last few days, the brigade's Fire Control Center destroyed the booby-trapped building where Sergeant Ori Itzchak Hadad fell.
location: The main location where the event takes place is Rafah, a city in the southern Gaza Strip.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: the Nahal Brigade Combat Team is operating in the Rafah area under the command of the 162nd Division.
Event 2: soldiers of the Nahal Reconnaissance Unit found an underground storage facility in the Rafah area which contained weapons, explosives, cartridges and rockets.
Event 3: a booby-trapped building where Sergeant Ori Itzchak Hadad fell was destroyed by the Fire Control Center of the Nahal Brigade Combat Team.

title: Ukraine warriors hold back tears as they say farewell to British cabbie , 49 , who was killed in the war where he had saved hundreds of lives as a combat medic
message:
Ukrainian soldiers fought back tears as they gathered in Kyiv today to pay last respects to a British combat medic and former cab driver killed in action.
Peter Fouche, 49, helped set up a charity called Project Konstantin which since 2022 has delivered essential supplies to frontline Ukrainian fighters in the bloody conflict against Russia.
According to its website, it has also helped evacuate 219 Ukrainian soldiers from combat zones.
Co-founder Mr Fouche - a former London taxi driver - died 'on the battlefield' on June 27 as his unit clashed with Russian troops, a colleague at Project Konstantin said.
Upon his arrival in Ukraine, Fouché volunteered to fight for Kyiv with one of many territorial defence units that were created following the outbreak of war.
event_breakdown:
* On June 27, 2022, a British combat medic and former cab driver identified as Peter Fouche died during a clash between Ukrainian forces and Russian troops in Kyiv.
* The medics helped set up a charity called Project Konstantin, which provided supplies to Ukrainian forces and evacuated 219 Ukrainian soldiers.

Relevant locations:
* Kyiv, Ukraine
* London, UK

title: Two more Congo soldiers sentenced to death for fleeing battle
message:
Two more Congo soldiers sentenced to death for fleeing battleWorld World Two more Congo soldiers sentenced to death for fleeing battleCongo lifted an over 20-year moratorium on the death penalty in FebruaryFollow on Published On: Sat, 06 Jul 2024 20:28:13 PKTBENI (Reuters) - Two more solders have been sentenced to death in the Democratic Republic of Congo after they fled battles in conflict-torn North Kivu province, a military court said.
The ruling, which follows the sentencing of 25 soldiers to death on Thursday, underscores the authorities' wish to show it will not tolerate the desertions that have contributed to putting Congo on the back foot in the conflict.
The military tribunal said on Friday that one of the soldiers, Kakule Mupasula Raphael, had abandoned the front line in Kanyabayonga and fled.
"There were a lot of us soldiers who fled Kanyabayonga ... even our commanders fled too," he told Reuters.
Congo lifted an over 20-year moratorium on the death penalty in February for crimes including desertion and treason.
event_breakdown:
New death sentences handed down in Beni
Two new death sentences have been handed down in Congo for soldiers who fled battle in conflict-torn Beni.
